sponsor.partnerMessage: Friends don’t let friends pay 5-6% on the sales price of their home! Not when they can get ‘Above & Beyond’ full-service real estate brokerage services on a flat-fee basis with Rock Florida’s Realty EPIC powered by eXp Realty. How much more would you have left in your wallet?

posts.title: Bella's Gifts Boutique Returns To Emma Ave
posts.content:
Bella's Gifts has returned to Emma Ave at the 202 Railside building! After a brief stint on Sunset Ave while Downtown Springdale underwent a significant update, the boutique is back where it belongs in the same spot it began 19 years ago.

  • Finally home: Bella's carries a great selection of clothing, gifts, baby items, toys, and plenty of Razorback gear to outfit you for basketball season! They also monogram, vinyl, and gift wrap.
  • Last call: This is the last week to shop at Bella's 2940 W Sunset Ave location, and they're offering a 75% discount on all items before they close the location for good.

Follow Bella's Gifts on Instagram for store updates and great deals HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville's TheatreSquared Building Is Racking Up The Accolades
posts.content:
TheatreSquared in Downtown Fayetteville will receive two prestigious awards for the building's architecture, adding to the creative space's growing trophy case of recognition for outstanding design.

  • Elite honors: The building has earned the 2023 American Institute of Architects NY Design Merit Award and recognition as the 2023 USITT Architecture Award, the highest international honor exclusively awarded for theatrical design.
  • What's in the box: The $31m, 50,000-sq-ft facility designed by Marvel Architects includes two theaters, learning rooms, rehearsal and meeting areas, indoor and outdoor gathering spaces, and a cafe.

Read more in the Fayetteville Flyer HERE.

posts.title: Bordinos Restaurant & Wine Bar Releases Winter Menu
posts.content:
What might be one of the most consistent restaurants in Downtown Fayetteville, Bordinos Restaurant & Wine Bar, never fails to impress.

  • New for 2023: Upon hearing about the release of Bordinos' winter menu, the NWA Daily team had to try it out. We indulged by starting off with a glass of their recommended wine to accompany their Charcuterie + Cheese board appetizer.
  • Chef's choice: Unable to decide on 'what's next,' we went with the chef's recommendation - their special rendition of Chicken Breast and Cioppino (lobster, mussels, clams, and shrimp in a tomato broth). It was flawless.

Serving NWA for over two decades, Bordinos is an ideal location for a special night on the town.

posts.title: Samaritan Community Center Fighting Childhood Hunger In NWA
posts.content:
Every weekend, thousands of children in Northwest Arkansas experience hunger without access to food from school cafeterias. Samaritan Community Center is taking action to alleviate childhood hunger through its SnackPacks for Kids program.

  • In the bag; Every week, SCC packs nearly 6,000 bags with eight healthy snacks to be distributed through 170 schools across Northwest Arkansas each Friday to children who are at risk for food insecurity over the weekend.
  • Take snack-tion: It costs approximately $3 to provide one child with a SnackPack each weekend. Join the fight against hunger by making a monthly donation, donating snacks, or hosting a food drive!

Learn more about SnackPacks for Kids HERE.

posts.title: Kim's Convenience Takes the Stage At TheatreSquared
posts.content:
Coming to TheatreSquared, the hilarious Korean-Canadian comedy Kim's Convenience by Ins Choi will run from Jan 25 to Feb 19.

  • The preshow: You might recognize the show from the award-winning comedy series on Netflix, but before it hit the screens, Kim's Convenience had its start on the stage.
  • Major props: Director Nelson Eusebio is excited to share this story that resonates deeply with him as an Asian American son of immigrants, and critics like the Toronto Star have said, "It's the kind of show that restores one's faith in the theatre."

Tickets range from $20-$54 and can be purchased HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Pizza and beer: Check out the new Smokin' Oak Wood-fired Pizza & Taproom in Fayetteville for artisan-quality, wood-fired pizzas and their unique digital taproom wall.*
  • Rockstar: The 2023 AMP lineup is taking shape, featuring artists like Beck, Phoenix, Eric Church, and most importantly, Kidz Bop and Nickelback... not at the same time, but frankly, that would be kind of awesome.
  • Hit the trail: This April, the International Mountain Bicycling Association is coming to Bentonville to host the Trail Labs Foundations workshops, teaching best practices for creating trail systems.
  • Flight delivery: Walmart has expanded its drone delivery services to seven states: Arkansas, Arizona, Florida, North Caroline, Texas, Utah, and Virginia.
  • Fire delivery: Watch twenty-two-year-old Jenae Watson reunite with the firefighters who came to the rescue during her sudden delivery as a baby.
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
